param.name: method
param.label: Select the sequencing method of the input file(s)

param.name: center_at
param.label: Subtract a constant number from all log2 ratios.
param.help: For manual re-centering, in case the --center option gives unsatisfactory results.)

param.name: thresholds
param.label: Hard thresholds for calling each integer copy number, separated by commas.
param.help: Use the '=' sign on the command line, e.g.: -t=-1,0,1

param.name: purity
param.label: Estimated tumor cell fraction, a.k.a. purity or cellularity.

param.name: drop_low_coverage
param.label: Drop very-low-coverage bins before segmentation
param.help: To avoid false-positive deletions in poor-quality tumor samples

param.name: male_reference
param.label: Use or assume a male reference
param.help: Was a male reference used? If so, expect half ploidy on chrX and chrY; otherwise, only chrY has half ploidy. In CNVkit, if a male reference was used, the neutral copy number (ploidy) of chrX is 1; chrY is haploid for either reference sex.

param.name: vcf
param.label: VCF file
param.help: VCF file name containing variants for calculation of b-allele frequencies.

param.name: sample_id
param.label: Name of the sample in the VCF to use for b-allele frequency extraction.

param.name: normal_id
param.label: Corresponding normal sample ID in the input VCF
param.help: This sample is used to select only germline SNVs to calculate b-allele frequencies.

param.name: min_variant_depth
param.label: Minimum read depth for a SNV to be used in the b-allele frequency calculation.

param.name: zygosity-freq
param.label: Ignore VCF's genotypes
param.help: Ignore VCF's genotypes and instead infer zygosity from allele frequencies.
